ExCnt.EX: In several fables the kelpie appears as a handsome young prince , who lures maidens to a watery fate worse than death .
Writers , led by Sir Walter Scott with his novel Ivanhoe , had fired the imaginations of the people with tales of chivalry , knightly deeds and maidens fair .
At midnight on a full moon maidens used to leave cakes of barley-meal , honey and milk on Arthur's Stone , Gower .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: horse that has never won a race

ExCnt.EX: Seven won last race and only two maidens have won the race .
Most races are run over 3 miles with a minimum of 18 fences to be jumped , although there are a few longer races ( up to 4 miles ) and a small number of 2 mile races for maidens .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: (of women ) unmarried and no longer young

ExCnt.EX: We were taught at home by Mam's maiden sister , Aunt Mary , who had not been to school herself .
I think she simply disliked children -- the way many maiden aunts must have done , in those days .
Another place across the dale from us was East New Houses , where a maiden lady lived when I was a child .
The train , which is powered by a linear magnetic motor and hovers 1 cm above its single-rail track , should make its maiden flight today on a 20 km run in Emsladn in Bavaria .
Undaunted , Adam Seymour scored his maiden century for Worcestershire on the sodden wicket .
Maamur showed , when winning a maiden race at Southwell last month by 10 lengths , that he has the potential to develop into a useful stayer and he is napped this afternoon .
He had won in the maiden class , for those who have yet to win a prize , in 1975 , but he had not been successful since moving into the growers ' section .
The maiden voyage may have to be postponed for five months as a result of a fault in one of Challenger 's fuel tanks .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: original surname of a married woman

ExCnt.EX: Gedge's unusual middle name was his mother's maiden name .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: (in cricket) an over in which the batsman scores no runs

ExCnt.EX: Unfortunately , the opening batsmen realised they would have to work hard for their runs as the same bowler proceeded to bowl a maiden over , supported by an efficient fielding team .
Brighton were always struggling to keep up with the required run rate after Darryl Rebbetts bowled 4 consecutive maiden overs at the start of their innings .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: first speech in a political gathering, esp. parliament

ExCnt.EX: I shall never , ever have to make another maiden speech in the House of Commons .
He left the Baptist ministry in 1842 and made his maiden speech to the House of Lords on the 7th of March 1843 .
Perhaps he needs a drink after listening to Lynda's maiden speech at the Parish Council .
